meanings.definition: To select a smaller sample from a larger population for analysis or study.
meanings.sent1: I subsampled the data to focus on a specific group of people.
meanings.sent2: Researchers often subsample the data to make it more manageable.
meanings.sent3: The scientist subsampled the data and found out that only a few participants liked the new product.
meanings.sent4: She subsampled the information like a detective narrowing down the suspects.
meanings.sent5: Subsampling the data helped me see patterns that were not clear before.

meanings.definition: A smaller sample taken from a larger population for analysis or study.
meanings.sent1: The subsampled group represented a diverse range of opinions.
meanings.sent2: The subsampled data provided valuable insights into customer preferences.
meanings.sent3: The tiny subsampled jar of cookies disappeared in minutes at the office party.
meanings.sent4: The subsampled section of the painting captured the essence of the entire artwork.
meanings.sent5: Examining the subsampled data revealed surprising trends in the market.
